intro: Erophila lucida, commonly known as the shining erophila, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Erophila lucida has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for native wildlife.
